distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for python fixes the following issues:

The following security vulnerabilities were addressed:

- Add a check to Lib/wave.py that verifies that at least one channel is
  provided. Prior to this, attackers could cause a denial of service via a
  crafted wav format audio file. [bsc#1083507, CVE-2017-18207]
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

full_product_name.name: python-strict-tls-check-2.7.13-28.6.1.aarch64 as component of SUSE Enterprise Storage 5
python-strict-tls-check-2.7.13-28.6.1.x86_64 as component of SUSE Enterprise Storage 5

notes.text: ** DISPUTED ** The Wave_read._read_fmt_chunk function in Lib/wave.py in Python through 3.6.4 does not ensure a nonzero channel value, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (divide-by-zero and exception) via a crafted wav format audio file. NOTE: the vendor disputes this issue because Python applications "need to be prepared to handle a wide variety of exceptions."
notes.title: Vulnerability description
